param.name: sample_metadata_path
param.label: sample metadata file
param.help: The metadata, a unique file with the description of the samples in your measures files. This is compulsory, see section Metadata File Information.

param.name: amount_material
param.label: amount material
param.help: Absolute path to the file having the amount of material by sample, for the normalization. This file must be a tab delimited file with exactly 2 columns with a header: the first column contains the original names of the samples, and the second column the numbers (tissue weight, number of cells, volume, etc)

param.name: remove_these_metabolites
param.label: remove metabolites using this file
param.help: Absolute path to the tab delimited file with columns: compartment, metabolite. This file lists the metabolites to be completely excluded, compartment specific. Defining such exclusion list requires deep knowledge of the data by the user (measurements coherence/quality, etc)

param.name: type_of_file_selector
param.label: Choose which type of input file is used

param.name: sheetname
param.label: name of the sheet containing the isotopologues corrected values

param.name: raw_abundance_sheet_name
param.label: name of the sheet containing the raw abundances values

param.name: frac_contribution_sheet_name
param.label: name of the sheet containing the mean enrichment values

param.name: corrected_isotopologues_sheet_name
param.label: name of the sheet containing the isotopologues corrected values

param.name: variable_metadata_path
param.label: variable metadata file
param.help: The metadata, a unique file with the description of the samples in your measures files. This is compulsory, see section Metadata File Information.

param.name: identifier
param.label: identifier of your metabolite in variable metadata file

param.name: compound
param.label: name of your metabolite in variable metadata file (formula is also accepted)

param.name: isotopologue_number
param.label: isotopologue number in variable metadata file

param.name: alternative_div_amount_material
param.label: alternative isotopologues division by amount material
param.help: In the normalisation by the amount of material, not only the division of the given absolute values by these amounts is performed, but also the product of the resulting quotients and the averaged amount of material is computed

param.name: div_isotopologues_by_amount_material
param.label: isotopologues by amount material
param.help: Apply normalization by the amount of material at the level of isotopologue absolute values. Immediately after this, and before any other computation, tracegroomer re-computes all derived (thus normalized) metrics

param.name: isotopologues_preview
param.label: Plot isotopologue
param.help: Generate simple plots that give a general overview of the isotopologue proportions given by the user. Performs a scatter plot of the individual isotopologue proportions for all metabolites, as well as a plot of the sums of isotopologue proportions (the sum must be equal to 1 for each metabolite and sample)

param.name: fractions_stomp_values
param.label: Stomps fractional contributions
param.help: Stomps fractional contributions (synonym: mean enrichment), and isotopologue proportions, to max 1.0 and min 0.0

param.name: subtract_blankavg
param.help: from samples' abundances, subtracts the average of the blanks for all metabolites across all samples. Note that the Internal Standards are not subjected to this operation, as recommended by VIB platform

param.name: under_detection_limit_set_nan
param.label: Limit Of Detection
param.help: The Limit Of Detection, LOD, corresponds to the averaged blanks abundance values, multiplied by three times the blanks standard deviation. By default, any value that is strictly inferior to its corresponding LOD, is converted into NaN

param.name: use_internal_standard
param.help: The name of the internal standard, which is a compound or metabolite that has been stated as reference signal. By providing this name, the normalization by the internal standard is automatically performed
param.label: internal standard

param.name: isosprop_min_admitted
param.label: isotopologues cutoff
param.help: Metabolites whose isotopologue proportions are less or equal to this cutoff, are removed
